description: Michigan Democrats are divided on how President Biden's recent debate performance will affect him. The unprecedented matchup between Biden and Donald Trump scramble any efforts to make forecasts.
title: Michigan voters share their views on Biden

description: A state won by razor thin margins in the last two elections, Republicans are hoping they can "lose by less" in key areas that will help them flip the state back to red.
title: Republicans are trying to lose by less in key blue areas in Wisconsin

description: The federal government announced a settlement with Marathon Oil for alleged air quality violations at the company's oil and gas operations on the Fort Berthold Indian Reservation in North Dakota.
title: Marathon Oil reaches a $241 million settlement with EPA for environmental violations

description: Hungary’s Prime Minister Viktor Orban arrived at the NATO summit in Washington after a controversial trip to Russia and China, and he’s planning to visit former President Trump in Florida.
title: How leaders at NATO summit are responding to Hungarian prime minister's Moscow visit

description: Inflation fell in June, as a drop in gasoline prices more than offset the modest monthly rise in rent. This could help clear the way for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates in September.
title: Lower gas prices helped inflation cool in June

description: NPR's Short Wave brings stories of lion brothers making a record-breaking swim in Uganda, the skincare trend among pre-teens that is worrying dermatologists, and a planet that smells like rotten eggs.
title: This week in science: swimming lions, the 'glass' skin craze and a rotten egg planet

description: Former President Trump and his campaign are working hard to disavow ties to Project 2025, the sweeping conservative plan led by the Heritage Foundation that seeks to transform the American government.
title: Trump is distancing himself from Project 2025, but some in his circle have ties to it

description: There’s no single reason for the slight drop in opioid overdose deaths across most of the U.S. last year. But finding new ways to make Narcan available in public, 24 hours a day, is helping.
title: Boxes holding Narcan in overdose hotspots can save lives, Massachusetts project shows

description: The Senate has overwhelmingly passed a landmark bill to bring more oversight to federal prisons. The legislation will soon head to the White House, for a signature from President Biden.
title: Congress passes a bill to bring new oversight to the troubled federal prison system

description: The City of Philadelphia ordered all city workers to return to the office five days a week starting July 15. A judge has heard arguments as part of a union request to delay implementation.
title: Thousands of Philadelphia city workers are fighting a 5-day office week mandate

description: NPR’s Scott Detrow talks with President Biden’s top economic adviser, Jared Bernstein, about the state of inflation in the United States according to Thursday's Consumer Price Index report.
title: Biden's top economic adviser on the state of inflation in the U.S.

description: NPR's Scott Detrow talks with labor reporter Josh Eidelson about a report he co-authored in Bloomberg Businessweek about the allegations of sexual harassment at SpaceX and the subsequent lawsuits.
title: Why SpaceX is facing off with the National Labor Relations Board

description: David Madland of the Center for American Progress says new, “good” jobs are on the rise, but many of the workers don’t know it’s a result of Biden’s new industrial policies.
title: Understanding the resurgence of jobs in America's 'left behind' counties

description: The grant, from Eric and Wendy Schmidt, will be used to launch regional newsrooms in Appalachia and the Mountain West. It will also be used to strengthen existing public media collaboratives in New England, the Midwest and California.
title: NPR gets $5.5 million grant to strengthen local journalism as news deserts spread

description: After opening arguments on Wednesday, testimony will continue this week in the involuntary manslaughter case against the actor.
title: Testimony is underway in Alec Baldwin's 'Rust' trial

description: With a skin sample from a 52,000-year-old woolly mammoth, scientists are gaining new insights into what made the animals tick. The findings could also help controversial de-extinction efforts.
title: A 3D reconstruction of the woolly mammoth genome might help revive the extinct species

description: Writers share advice on how to sensitively interview family members about painful or traumatic memories. These conversations may get loved ones to open up -- and deepen our connections with them.
title: To capture a parent’s hidden story, practice patience -- and let the tears flow

description: A new study identifies why cats scratch the furniture and what you can do to curb that behavior.
title: Why do cats scratch furniture? A new study found answers

description: Power is still out for more than a million customers as the city’s primary utility is under mounting criticism for its response.
title: Frustration continues in Houston in the aftermath of Hurricane Beryl

description: A new Cook Political Report poll sees a shift in several swing states toward former President Donald Trump.
title: A new report releases data on shifting swing states

description: President Biden’s first formal solo news conference of the year is being closely watched to see how he handles curveballs. Many in his own party want him to step back from his reelection bid.
title: Biden is holding a rare solo news conference to try to show he’s up for this campaign

description: The U.S. Constitution requires a president to be 35 or older, but only a lower age limit exists. There has never been an upper one.
title: Our presidential candidates have never been older. You can thank the Founding Fathers

description: American Rounds has installed machines at eight stores so far, with hundreds more on the way. It says this is the safest way to sell ammo, but cyber and gun violence prevention experts have concerns.
title: Bread and bullets: Some southern supermarkets now sell ammo out of vending machines

description: South Africa's new sports minister once drove getaway cars in bank heists. Now he's in government, with plans to bring the dangerous pass time of car spinning out of the shadows and into the mainstream.
title: From convict to cabinet: South Africa’s new sports minister promotes gangland motorsport

description: Health-care facilities have been under attack by both sides in Sudan’s year-long civil war; aid groups are trying to shore up care with mobile clinics but fear the need is too great.
title: Attacks on Sudan's hospitals, clinics put millions at risk

description: Tracy Matheson's organization is funding makeovers of rooms that police use to interview sexual assault victims. The project was inspired by the violent death of Matheson's daughter.
title: After a tragedy, a mother wants to soften the rooms where police interview victims

description: Biden's Democratic critics have compared his achievements to that of President Lyndon B. Johnson, while noting LBJ had bowed out in the best interests of the party and the country and provided a model for others.
title: Biden confronts his own LBJ’s choice

description: For most people, power outages are an inconvenience. For those who count on electricity for home medical equipment, they can be a crisis. Here's how to plan ahead for health care needs in a blackout.
title: How to prepare for power outages if your health depends on home medical devices

description: After calling Project 2025 "ridiculous," Trump continued to distance himself from the conservative roadmap for the next Republican president. Meanwhile, the Biden team wants to tie the plan to Trump.
title: It seems like Project 2025 is everywhere. But what is it?

description: The American Civil Liberties Union is developing a legal strategy to counter former President Donald Trump in the event he returns to the White House.
title: The ACLU has a blueprint to constrain Trump in a second presidential term

description: It’s not your imagination. Temperature records are falling across the U.S. Climate scientists say they've been predicting this for decades.
title: 'We're screaming into the void.' Across the U.S., heat keeps breaking records

description: Record numbers of Americans face unaffordable rent and home prices. If you’re among them, please tell us about the sacrifices or creative solutions this has meant for you.
title: What has helped you afford housing in this market? We want to hear from you

description: Before old mill dams are demolished in the North Carolina mountains, a search and rescue operation begins for the country's largest salamanders.
title: Before a N.C. dam is removed, biologists search for America’s largest salamander

description: The Planet Money team looks to the economic research for an answer.
title: 'Planet Money': Do immigrants really take jobs and lower wages?

description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with energy expert Michael Webber about how utilities can manage extreme weather events like Hurricane Beryl.
title: Hurricane Beryl is another example of why the power grid needs to be more resilient

description: It's England v. Spain in Sunday's Euro final. England squeaked by the Dutch with a late goal. Meanwhile, U.S. Soccer fired coach Gregg Berhalter after an early exit from the Copa America tournament.
title: U.S. Soccer fires coach as the Copa America tournament winds down

description: Target is the latest retailer to announce it will stop accepting checks. The last day is July 15. The Federal Reserve says check-writing has declined by almost 75% since 2000.
title: More and more retailers are no longer accepting personal checks

description: NPR's A Martinez talks to journalist Chantal Fernandez about Abercrombie and Fitch's rebrand, and how the chain has managed to recapture its customer base.
title: Officials at Abercrombie & Fitch have been successful at turning the business around
